name: Borg Brugghús - Award-Winning Progressive Craft Brewery
description: Borg Brugghús represents Iceland's progressive craft beer movement, founded in 2010 with principal aim of incorporating Icelandic cultural traits and local ingredients into wide variety of beers while achieving international recognition through innovative brewing that respects Nordic traditions while pushing boundaries with bold flavor profiles and experimental techniques. The brewery quickly established credentials by winning Beer World Cup with their first beer, Bríó (lager), just couple years after launch—this early success validated their approach and opened international markets where Icelandic craft beer remained unknown commodity. Subsequent awards at noted international competitions cemented Borg's reputation as serious brewing operation rather than novelty producers trading on Iceland's exotic reputation. While technically part of Egill brewery (providing production facilities and distribution infrastructure that small independent breweries struggle to afford), Borg Brugghús operates with sufficient autonomy and distinct brand identity that they deserve independent recognition in Iceland's craft beer landscape. The beer lineup showcases Norse-inspired names connecting products to Iceland's cultural heritage: Úlfur IPA stands as flagship offering with bold grapefruit and pine flavors representing American IPA tradition adapted to Icelandic brewing; Surtur imperial stout series pushes alcohol content past 14% while bringing deep layers of vanilla and chocolate that satisfy extreme beer enthusiasts seeking intensity and complexity; Garún (stout) provides darker.
address: Reykjavík, Iceland (part of Egill brewery, distributed throughout capital region)
